column18: comments

They describe themselves as family-owned, values-led organisation on their website. So they disagree with corporate owned description. Looking at companies house confirmations, they are owned by CHERISH (UK) LIMITED, which is owned by CHERISH HOLDINGS LIMITED. It probably is not far off family owned, but is within our definition of a corporate chain, given there are more than one operating companies.

Their website describes them as individual owned: "Positive Pathways is a private limited company, owned and managed by Kevin and Danielle Epps". Let's check companies house… yep two shareholders Kev and Dan Epps
Nothing on their website. Owned by 5 individuals, who also run Outbound Academy - but not a huge chain of companies or anything

Home with 4 beds run by a school, but not a school. They have a complex ownership structure which includes the companies CHP INVESTMENTS 3 LIMITED and AZTEC FINANCIAL SERVICES (UK) LIMITED. AZTEC FINANCIAL SERVICES (UK) LIMITED has a sic code of 64999 - Financial intermediation not elsewhere classified. FAME also gives them investment NACE code. Ultimate owner is in the cayman islands. This is incorrect, but the reason it is unclassified is because the shareholder in Fame has the industrial classification code of being in property and rentals - not finance. And then the company names don't include any search terms
column20: Add Cayman = investment; Add "Investment" to search term
